channel.title: Editing server ip?
channel.description: Is it possible to change the server ip to the website? I've seen alot of toplist entries that only use their website.

item.title: Editing server ip?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:8, topic:404137”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=501192.msg3668218#msg3668218 date=1310748588]
Actually this belongs nowhere. You’re not supposed to use a web server as your ‘server’ for the toplist, and if you’ve made a server status page already you can’t change your IP
[/quote]
I didn’t know this. If I may ask, what is the problem against doing so?

edit: oh, maybe it’s because the server is always online… or something?[/quote]Yes, if you use a webserver you’re basically duping your online time.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing server ip?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Davidi2:

Actually this belongs nowhere. You’re not supposed to use a web server as your ‘server’ for the toplist, and if you’ve made a server status page already you can’t change your IP

I didn’t know this. If I may ask, what is the problem against doing so?

edit: oh, maybe it’s because the server is always online… or something?

Read full topic

Actually this belongs nowhere. You’re not supposed to use a web server as your ‘server’ for the toplist, and if you’ve made a server status page already you can’t change your IP

item.title: Editing server ip?
item.dc:creator: @B2300_T4nk B2300 T4nk
item.description:
@B2300_T4nk wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:5, topic:404137”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=501192.msg3666673#msg3666673 date=1310668914]

Wrong section… Post it under Server Help

No this would be Client Help, get it right before you criticize.

Technically this is possible but most people who do it get banned, what they do is set up their VPS for connection from their sites address so it can register the server, then they use a different IP address for the client and put their site up so that they stay at 100% up time (sites are a lot harder to crash then servers). Never the less don’t try it, its not worth it to be banned for life from the server list.
[/quote]
Huh???[/quote]tl;dr

What he said is that don’t put the IP address as your website address. If you do that; U WAN BAN!?!

Read full topic

Wrong section… Post it under Server Help
[/quote]
No this would be Client Help, get it right before you criticize.

Technically this is possible but most people who do it get banned, what they do is set up their VPS for connection from their sites address so it can register the server, then they use a different IP address for the client and put their site up so that they stay at 100% up time (sites are a lot harder to crash then servers). Never the less don’t try it, its not worth it to be banned for life from the server list.[/quote]
Huh???

item.title: Editing server ip?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

(N)eon:

Wrong section… Post it under Server Help

No this would be Client Help, get it right before you criticize.

Technically this is possible but most people who do it get banned, what they do is set up their VPS for connection from their sites address so it can register the server, then they use a different IP address for the client and put their site up so that they stay at 100% up time (sites are a lot harder to crash then servers). Never the less don’t try it, its not worth it to be banned for life from the server list.

Read full topic
